content: Cuba Ousts Top Government Officials Raul Castro's Major Cabinet Shakeup Includes Replacing Foreign And Economy Ministers (AP) President Raul Castro shook up Cuba's top leadership on Monday, replacing key figures tied to his brother Fidel Castro with others apparently closer to him. The abrupt shakeup came a year after Fidel Castro handed the presidency to his younger brother because of poor health. It was announced at the end of the midday news, after the weather and sports. Perhaps the most prominent of those ousted, Foreign Minister Felipe Perez Roque, was the youngest of Cuba's top leaders and had been widely mentioned as a possible future president. Perez Roque, 43, was replaced by his own deputy, Bruno Rodriguez. >http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2009/03/02/world/main4838829.shtml I wonder what else will change.
reply: Cuba Ousts Top Government Officials Raul Castro's Major Cabinet Shakeup Includes Replacing Foreign And Economy Ministers (AP) President Raul Castro shook up Cuba's top leadership on Monday, replacing key figures tied to his brother Fidel Castro with others apparently closer to him. The abrupt shakeup came a year after Fidel Castro handed the presidency to his younger brother because of poor health. It was announced at the end of the midday news, after the weather and sports. Perhaps the most prominent of those ousted, Foreign Minister Felipe Perez Roque, was the youngest of Cuba's top leaders and had been widely mentioned as a possible future president. Perez Roque, 43, was replaced by his own deputy, Bruno Rodriguez. >http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2009/03/02/world/main4838829.shtml I wonder what else will change.
title: A Shakeup In Cuba

content: sounds like raul is consolidating his power. i wonder if h will be able to hold he reins when Fidel is gone..... Felipe Perez Roque is a charismatic man who commands quite a following. his youth has been his card up the sleeve. he is closer in touch with the new needs of Cuba, and has taken steps to insure some economic freedom once the castro family is gone. i guess it all boils down to "what is in store for post castro Cuba"?
reply: sounds like raul is consolidating his power. i wonder if h will be able to hold he reins when Fidel is gone..... content: I would not be surprised at all if the people of Cuba cleanse their government of anything Castro once Fidel is gone. Whatever takes place it is going to be interesting to watch.

title: A Shakeup In Cuba

content: I forsee a coup once Fidel is gone.
reply: I forsee a coup once Fidel is gone.
title: A Shakeup In Cuba

content: I was talking with a friend recently that works in management at a major cruise line and he tells me that the cruise lines have already drawn up itineraries to include Cuba as a new port of call if the embargo is ever lifted or if the Cuban government changes. Pre Castro Cuba was a very popular tourist destination for Americans and the cruise lines are very anxious for it to be again.
